coverage_summary: Comprehensive home insurance policy covering buildings and contents against various risks including fire, theft, flood, storm, accidental damage, and more. Includes worldwide contents cover, personal liability protection, and various additional covers including identity theft protection and health helpline services.
key_inclusions: Loss and accidental damage to buildings and contents
Fire, smoke, explosion, lightning, earthquake damage
Escape of water from fixed installations
Tenant's liability (20% of contents sum insured)
Garden plants, lawns and gardens cover (up to £5,000 each)
Visitors' personal effects (up to £5,000 per visitor)
Fatal accident or acquired disability benefit (up to £50,000 per incident)
House removal cover (60 days storage included)
Special events automatic increase (10% for 60 days around event)
key_exclusions: Gradual damage, wear and tear, depreciation
Poor maintenance and lack of repair
Mechanical or electrical breakdown (except food in fridge/freezer)
Settlement of new properties
Damage by domestic animals (chewing, scratching, fouling)
Infestation and vermin damage
War, invasion, terrorism (except riot/civil commotion)
Nuclear contamination and radioactive risks
Pollution (except sudden identifiable incidents)
Sonic bangs from aircraft
Reduction in market value (except fine art/antiques/collectables)
Confiscation by authorities
Deliberate, wilful, malicious damage by policyholder/family
Virtual currencies and fluctuations
Loss while home unoccupied over 60 days (for certain perils)
Loss while home unfurnished over 60 days (for certain perils)
Damage to gates, hedges, fences by storm/flood
Subsidence to boundary walls, gates, hedges, fences, paths, drives unless main building damaged
Subsidence from construction, defective materials, coastal erosion
Damage arising from alterations/extensions
Faulty workmanship, defective design, defective materials
Escape of water from failure of sealant/grout
Theft from unlocked vehicles/hotel rooms
Theft from unoccupied/unfurnished property
Theft without forcible entry if part of home occupied by non-family
Business equipment removed from home
Money, valuables, business equipment left in open
Vehicles and craft (with specific exceptions)
Drones and mechanically propelled aerial devices
Dangerous dogs listed under Dangerous Dogs Act
Non-domesticated animals
Horses, ponies, donkeys, mules
Items in storage over 60 days (unless professional facility)
Pitch fibre drain defects
Claims outside UK, Channel Islands, Isle of Man (for liability)
Frozen food loss from electricity supplier action/strike
Damage to property in custody/control (for liability claims)
Transmission of contagious disease/virus
Business, trade, profession activities
Data loss from hacking, viruses, malware
Property obtained with fraudulent payment
Loss more specifically insured elsewhere
Sanctions-related claims
Unattended pedal cycles unless locked
Personal effects from student accommodation without forcible entry
China, glass, porcelain during house removal unless professionally packed
Jewellery, money during house removal
Sea transit during house removal
Theft as result of failed online purchases

coverage_limits.contents_sum_insured: As shown in schedule - full replacement value up to sum insured
coverage_limits.valuables_total: Up to limit shown in schedule
coverage_limits.alternative_accommodation: Reasonable costs for up to 3 years
coverage_limits.items_in_storage: 20% of contents sum insured (max 60 days in professional facility)
coverage_limits.theft_unattended_items: £15,000 (unless in bank/safe deposit or residence where working/living)

sub_limits.fine_art_loss_in_value: Up to market value immediately prior to loss (for repaired/restored items)
sub_limits.matching_sets_suites: Individual damaged items plus up to 50% towards undamaged parts
sub_limits.floor_coverings: Damaged area only, not adjoining rooms
sub_limits.keys_and_locks: No specific limit stated, reasonable costs

special_conditions: Home must be maintained in good repair
Must take reasonable precautions to prevent loss/damage
Must notify insurer if contents full replacement value exceeds sum insured
Underinsurance clause applies - proportionate settlement if sum insured less than 100% of value
Security requirements may be endorsed on policy - failure may result in higher excess
Subsidence claims: must notify as soon as possible
Escape of water: must keep heating on low or drain system when away in winter
Escape of water cover ceases after 60 days unoccupied
Unoccupied defined as not lived in/occupied overnight for 60+ consecutive days
Unfurnished defined as insufficient furniture for normal living for 60+ consecutive days
Valuables must be specified if over £15,000 individual value
Professional removal contractors required for house removal cover
Acquisitions must be notified within 30 days and additional premium paid
Identity theft: must contact helpline, complete claim form, file police report, notify banks within reasonable time
Identity theft claims must be made within 6 months of policy end
Approved suppliers may be appointed - guaranteed repairs
Cash settlements limited to amount that would be paid to preferred supplier
Sum insured not reduced by claims (automatic reinstatement)
Buildings repair/reinstatement must be carried out for full settlement
Monthly inflation indexing applied to contents sum insured
If selling home, buyer has protection until completion (if not otherwise insured)
Must comply with all endorsements shown on schedule
Storm defined as wind 48+ knots, rainfall 25mm+/hour, snow 30cm+/24hrs, or damaging hail
Multiple factors considered for storm claims beyond definition
Lithium-ion battery safety requirements for e-bikes/scooters
excess_deductible: Amount shown in schedule applies to each claim. May vary by peril or be increased by endorsement. Higher theft excess may apply if security requirements not met.
geographical_coverage: United Kingdom, Channel Islands, and Isle of Man for buildings and home-based contents. Contents covered worldwide when temporarily removed. Personal liability covered in UK, Channel Islands, Isle of Man. Some covers (like unrecovered damages) require UK court judgments.
age_restrictions: No specific age restrictions mentioned for policyholders. Fatal accident benefits apply to family members of any age. Health at Hand service available to all ages.
pre_existing_conditions: Not applicable for property insurance. However, for Identity Theft cover, the theft must occur during the policy period.
cancellation_policy: 14-day cooling off period from receipt of documents. Within cooling off: full refund if not started, pro-rata refund if started (no claims). After cooling off: pro-rata refund if no claims and refund exceeds £15. If paying by instalments and have claimed, must continue instalments or outstanding amount deducted from claim. No refund if claim made/in progress. Insurer can cancel on 14 days notice for valid reasons including: inaccurate information, unacceptable risk changes, fraud, non-payment, threatening/abusive behavior.

endorsements.name: Security Requirements
endorsements.description: Specifies required locks, alarm systems, or other security measures that must be in place
endorsements.cost_impact: May reduce premium if installed, or endorsement added as condition of cover
endorsements.coverage_impact: Failure to maintain security may result in higher theft excess or declined theft claims

endorsements.name: Increased Single Article Limit
endorsements.description: Increases the £15,000 standard limit for individual valuables/personal effects
endorsements.coverage_impact: Allows higher value items to be fully covered

endorsements.name: Increased Valuables Limit
endorsements.description: Increases total limit for all valuables beyond standard
endorsements.cost_impact: Additional premium charged based on increased value
endorsements.coverage_impact: Provides higher total coverage for valuable items

endorsements.name: Unoccupancy/Unfurnished Restrictions
endorsements.cost_impact: May increase or decrease premium depending on circumstances
endorsements.coverage_impact: Changes when certain covers cease during unoccupancy

endorsements.name: Excess Variations
endorsements.description: Changes excess amounts for specific perils (e.g., higher subsidence excess, higher theft excess)
endorsements.cost_impact: Usually reduces premium if excess increased
endorsements.coverage_impact: Customer pays more of each claim up to excess amount

endorsements.name: Business Use
endorsements.description: May extend or restrict business equipment/use coverage
endorsements.cost_impact: Additional premium if extending business cover

endorsements.name: Property Type Restrictions

endorsements.cost_impact: May increase premium for higher risk properties
endorsements.coverage_impact: May add exclusions or requirements for certain building types

claims_requirements.notification_timeframe: As soon as possible after discovery. Identity theft claims within 6 months of policy end. For liability claims, send writs/summons/letters of claim as soon as possible.
required_documents: Police crime/lost property reference number (for theft/malicious damage)
Original purchase receipts, invoices, bank/credit card statements
Utility bills, pre-purchase surveys, plans and deeds (for buildings)
For identity theft: completed claim form, police report, proof of address for last 6 years, evidence from employer for lost wages, copies of demands/notices/legal papers
For fatal accident: death certificate, evidence of incident within 12 months
For disability: medical evidence of permanent disability
process_steps: 1. Take steps to prevent further damage (turn off utilities if needed)
2. Report to police if theft/malicious damage and obtain reference number
3. Call domestic helpline for emergency repairs (customer pays costs)
4. Call appropriate claims number: 0330 024 6843 for contents/buildings, 0330 024 8687 for identity theft
5. Provide policy number and loss details
6. AXA may appoint approved supplier or loss adjuster to contact you
7. Do not dispose of damaged items or make permanent repairs before inspection
8. Provide requested documentation within 30 days if asked
10. Allow access for inspection of damage
11. For liability claims: do not admit/deny or agree settlement; forward all documents immediately
claims_requirements.evidence_requirements: Police reports for theft/vandalism. Original purchase receipts preferred. Bank/credit card statements acceptable. Photographs of items/damage helpful. For buildings: surveys, deeds, plans. For valuables: authenticity certificates, valuations. For identity theft: address history proof, police report, bank notifications, employer confirmation of time off. Must prove ownership and value.
claims_requirements.claims_contact: Contents and Buildings claims: 0330 024 6843. Identity theft: 0330 024 8687. Domestic helpline: 0330 024 6849. Have policy number ready.

eligibility_criteria.age_limits: No specific age limits for policyholder mentioned
eligibility_criteria.medical_restrictions: None for property insurance. Health at Hand does not diagnose/prescribe and doesn't replace GP.
eligibility_criteria.occupational_restrictions: Home must be used for private residential purposes primarily. Business use from home has restrictions - business equipment covered to £15,000 but business use may require endorsement. Cannot use for trade/profession beyond allowed limits.
eligibility_criteria.residency_requirements: Must be UK resident. Property must be in UK, Channel Islands, or Isle of Man. Named policyholder must permanently live at the property with family.
other_restrictions: Home must be maintained in good repair
Cannot be unoccupied/unfurnished over 60 days for certain covers
Must not be sub-let without notification (changes cover)
Security requirements must be met if endorsed on policy
Must not have undisclosed criminal convictions (except motoring) or bankruptcy
Must provide accurate information at inception, renewal, and mid-term changes
Cannot be a commercial property or property mainly used for business
If renting out part of home, must notify insurer

policy_definitions.accidental_damage: Sudden, unexpected damage caused by an external force, not caused deliberately
policy_definitions.buildings: The structure of the home including fixtures/fittings, and: oil/gas tanks, cesspits, septic tanks, swimming pools, hot tubs, ponds, fountains, tennis courts, walls, gates, fences, hedges, terraces, patios, drives, paths, artificial lawns, statues, decking, railings, gazebos, pergolas, car ports, garages, external lighting/alarms/surveillance, heat pumps, solar systems, wind turbines, fixed recreational toys, brick BBQs, laminated/wood/vinyl flooring that cannot be removed and reused, inspection hatches/covers, outbuildings
policy_definitions.contents: Household goods including: furniture, furnishings, fixtures/fittings, decorations, carpets, gardening equipment, domestic appliances, food/drink (except wine over £5k), office equipment, aerials/dishes, unfixed outdoor items, personal effects, valuables, fine art/antiques/collectables, money, business equipment - owned by or legal responsibility of you/family, used mainly for private purposes. EXCLUDES: vehicles/craft, living creatures, documents, downloaded files, lottery tickets, structural parts tenant not responsible for
policy_definitions.family: Your spouse/domestic partner/civil partner, children, domestic staff, and any other person permanently living with you not paying for accommodation
policy_definitions.home: The private residence shown in schedule including garages and outbuildings forming part of the property
policy_definitions.unoccupied: Not lived in and not occupied overnight by you, family, or authorized person for more than 60 consecutive days
policy_definitions.unfurnished: Does not contain enough furniture and furnishings for normal living purposes for more than 60 consecutive days
policy_definitions.valuables: Jewellery (including costume), watches, cameras, camera lenses, furs, and fine art/antiques/collectables
policy_definitions.fine_art_antiques_collectables: Individual items/collections/sets with artistic/historical value or rare/unique including: paintings, drawings, etchings, photos, prints, manuscripts, sculptures, statues, tapestries, rugs, stamps, coins, medals, gold/silver/precious metals/gemstones, china/glass/porcelain collectables, antique furniture/books/clocks/barometers, wine over £5k, guns. EXCLUDES music collections, non-antique memorabilia, jewellery/watches/furs
policy_definitions.personal_effects: Items of personal nature likely to be worn/used/carried including: clothing, accessories, motorcycle gear, specialist clothing, laptops, tablets, mobiles, e-readers, games consoles, portable sat-navs, electronic equipment designed portable, hearing aids, wheelchairs, spectacles, contacts, portable medical equipment, cameras, camcorders, sports equipment, pedal cycles
policy_definitions.money: Coins/banknotes in current use, cheques, postal orders, postage stamps (not collections), trading stamps, premium bonds, saving stamps/certificates, luncheon vouchers, money orders, travel tickets, season tickets, petrol coupons, gift vouchers/cards, phone cards, pre-booked event tickets, electronic money cards. EXCLUDES credit/cheque/cash dispenser cards
policy_definitions.vehicles_or_craft: Electrically/mechanically propelled vehicles (motorcycles, e-scooters, segways, quad bikes); aircraft (gliders, hang gliders, drones); boats, hovercraft, water craft (sailboards, windsurfers); trailers, carts, wagons, caravans, horseboxes; parts/accessories/tools/fitted electronics for these. EXCLUDES: domestic lawnmowers, wheelchairs/mobility scooters for intended use, surfboards/water-skis/snowboards/skis, toys/models, pedal cycles (including e-assist to 250W/15.5mph), golf trolleys controlled on foot, portable sat-navs/GPS not fixed to vehicle
policy_definitions.storm: Period of violent weather: wind gusts 48+ knots (55mph), OR rainfall 25mm+/hour, OR snow 30cm+ in 24hrs, OR hail damaging hard surfaces/breaking glass. NOTE: Multiple factors considered in assessment beyond this definition
policy_definitions.flood: Invasion of property by large volume of water from rapid build-up or sudden release from outside the buildings
policy_definitions.subsidence: Downward movement of site on which buildings situated, NOT caused by settlement or building weight
policy_definitions.heave: Upward or sideways movement of site, NOT caused by settlement, caused by ground swelling
policy_definitions.landslip: Sudden soil movement on slope or gradual slope creep, NOT settlement
policy_definitions.settlement: Natural movement of new properties in months/years after building - NOT COVERED
policy_definitions.excess: Amount you must pay as first part of each and every claim
policy_definitions.endorsement: Change to policy terms shown under endorsements in schedule
policy_definitions.period_of_insurance: Time period shown in schedule during which cover applies
policy_definitions.you/your: Person(s) named in schedule as policyholder(s)
policy_definitions.domestic_staff: Person employed by you/family for domestic duties at home, not for business/trade/profession
policy_definitions.outbuildings: Sheds, greenhouses, summer houses, other buildings (not caravans, mobile homes, motor homes, canvas/PVC/non-rigid structures) not forming part of main home structure
policy_definitions.business_equipment: Items/equipment including computing equipment (excluding data) used mainly for business/trade/professional/employment purposes. Includes stock but excludes business money and documents
policy_definitions.vermin: Rats, mice, squirrels, owls, pigeons, foxes, bees, wasps, hornets
policy_definitions.payment_card: Bank, charge, cheque, credit, debit, cash dispenser cards
policy_definitions.identity_theft: Misappropriation of another person's identity without their knowledge/consent, used to obtain goods/services in their name
policy_definitions.action: Civil or criminal proceeding for monetary damages as result of identity theft

common_questions.question: What is the difference between buildings and contents insurance?
common_questions.answer: Buildings insurance covers the structure of your home including fixtures/fittings and permanent features like walls, fences, paths, garages, outbuildings. Contents insurance covers your household goods, furniture, appliances, personal belongings, and valuables inside the home and temporarily removed from it.
common_questions.section_reference: Meanings of defined terms - Buildings and Contents definitions, pages 8-9

common_questions.question: Am I covered for accidental damage?
common_questions.answer: Yes, both buildings and contents are covered for accidental damage as standard on this AXA Advanced policy. Accidental damage means sudden, unexpected damage from an external force. However, numerous exclusions apply including wear and tear, gradual damage, poor maintenance, mechanical/electrical breakdown, damage by pets, and damage while property is unoccupied/unfurnished.
common_questions.section_reference: Contents Cause 1 and Buildings Cause 1, pages 22-23 and 30

common_questions.question: How long can I leave my home unoccupied?
common_questions.answer: Unoccupied means not lived in or occupied overnight for more than 60 consecutive days. After 60 days, you lose cover for: malicious damage, theft, escape of water, oil leaks, accidental glass breakage. You still have cover for other perils like fire, storm, flood etc. You must notify AXA if your home will be unoccupied.
common_questions.section_reference: Meanings of defined terms page 10, Contents and Buildings exclusions pages 22-23 and 30

common_questions.question: Are my belongings covered when I travel abroad?
common_questions.answer: Yes, your contents are covered worldwide when temporarily removed from the home. However, limits apply: £15,000 for theft from unattended vehicles, £15,000 for theft from hotel rooms, £15,000 for theft of unattended items (unless in bank/safe deposit or residence where you're working/living). Valuables left unattended outside the home have limited cover.
common_questions.section_reference: Contents worldwide section, limits on page 22

common_questions.question: What is subsidence and is it covered?
common_questions.answer: Subsidence is downward movement of the site on which your buildings are situated (not caused by the building's weight or settlement). It is covered. However, damage to boundary walls, fences, hedges, paths, drives, swimming pools etc. is only covered if the main building is damaged at the same time. Not covered if caused by construction, defective materials, coastal erosion, or affecting only non-load-bearing walls/solid floor slabs. You should notify AXA as soon as you suspect subsidence.
common_questions.section_reference: Meanings of defined terms page 10, Buildings exclusions page 30, Important information page 4

common_questions.question: Does the policy cover me if I have a flood?
common_questions.answer: Yes, flood damage is covered for both buildings and contents. Flood means invasion of property by large volume of water from outside the buildings. However, damage to gates, hedges, fences is excluded. Not covered if your home is unoccupied over 60 days. If you have a flood claim over £10,000 for buildings repair, AXA will also pay up to £10,000 extra to help reduce future flooding risk.
common_questions.section_reference: Cause 1 coverage, Meanings of defined terms page 9, Buildings Cover 11 page 32-33

common_questions.question: What should I do if I have an escape of water?
common_questions.answer: Turn off the water at the mains and call the Domestic helpline (0330 024 6849) for emergency assistance, then call the claims line (0330 024 6843). AXA covers damage caused by water escaping from fixed installations, washing machines, dishwashers etc. However, the cost of repairing the source (like a worn-out pipe) is not covered - only the damage the water caused. You must keep your heating on low when away in winter or drain the system. Cover ceases if property unoccupied over 60 days.
common_questions.section_reference: Important information page 4, Making a claim page 16, Contents/Buildings Cause 1

common_questions.question: Are there any limits on individual valuable items?
common_questions.answer: Yes, any single valuable or personal effect is limited to £15,000 unless it's specified on your schedule with a higher limit. The total for all valuables is limited to the valuables limit shown in your schedule. You should tell AXA about items worth over £15,000 so they can be specified.
common_questions.section_reference: Coverage limits page 22, Meanings of defined terms page 10

common_questions.question: What excess do I have to pay?
common_questions.answer: You must pay the excess shown in your schedule on each and every claim. Different excesses may apply for different types of claim. If you don't meet security requirements endorsed on your policy, you may have to pay a higher theft excess. The excess is the first part of every claim that you must pay yourself.
common_questions.section_reference: Meanings of defined terms page 9, General conditions page 12, Special conditions page 28

common_questions.question: Can I cancel my policy?
common_questions.answer: Yes. Within 14 days of receiving your documents (cooling off period), you'll get a full refund if cover hasn't started, or a pro-rata refund if it has (provided no claims). After 14 days, you can cancel anytime and get a pro-rata refund if you haven't claimed and the refund exceeds £15. If you have claimed or are claiming, you won't get a refund (or may need to continue instalments until renewal if paying monthly).
common_questions.section_reference: General conditions - Cancelling the policy, pages 13-14

common_questions.question: What is not covered under this policy?
common_questions.answer: Main exclusions include: wear and tear, gradual damage, poor maintenance, mechanical/electrical breakdown, damage by pets, vermin, loss while unoccupied over 60 days (certain perils), theft without force, deliberate damage, business use beyond limits, vehicles/craft (with some exceptions), reduction in value (except antiques), war, terrorism (except riot), nuclear risks, pollution (except sudden events), loss from fraudulent payment, items more specifically insured elsewhere. A full list is in the exclusions sections throughout the policy.
common_questions.section_reference: General exclusions pages 15, Contents exclusions pages 22-24, Buildings exclusions page 30

common_questions.question: Am I covered for storm damage?
common_questions.answer: Yes, storm damage is covered for buildings and contents. AXA defines storm as: wind gusts 48+ knots (55mph), OR rainfall 25mm+/hour, OR snow 30cm+ in 24 hours, OR hail damaging hard surfaces/breaking glass. However, AXA considers multiple factors when assessing storm claims, not just this definition. They'll look at whether storm conditions occurred, whether damage is consistent with storm, and whether storm was the main cause (not poor maintenance or wear and tear). Not covered for gates, hedges, fences.
common_questions.section_reference: Meanings of defined terms page 10, How we settle claims - Storm damage page 20, Important information page 5

common_questions.question: What is alternative accommodation cover?
common_questions.answer: If your home cannot be lived in because of insured damage, AXA will pay reasonable costs for alternative accommodation for you, your family, and domestic animals for up to 3 years. They'll also pay rent you're liable for or would have received. AXA determines 'reasonable cost' based on your circumstances, your needs, how long you'll need it, and what's available locally.
common_questions.section_reference: Contents Cover 4 page 24, Buildings Cover 2 pages 30-31

common_questions.question: Is my bicycle covered?
common_questions.answer: Yes, pedal cycles are covered as contents (including electrically assisted pedal cycles up to 250W that don't propel the bike over 15.5mph). However, if stolen while unattended, they must be in a locked building or secured by a suitable lock to a permanent structure or motor vehicle. Cycles are covered worldwide up to the contents sum insured, subject to the theft from vehicle/unattended items limits.
common_questions.section_reference: Meanings of defined terms - Personal effects page 10, Vehicles or craft exclusions page 10-11, Contents Cause 1 exclusions page 23

common_questions.question: What identity theft cover do I get?
common_questions.answer: You get up to £50,000 cover for: legal costs defending claims from card issuers, costs to prove innocence, costs to remove wrongful judgments, costs to challenge credit reports, postal/phone costs dealing with the issue, loan reapplication fees, and lost earnings taking time off work. You must contact the Identity Theft helpline (0330 024 8687) first, then complete a claim form, file a police report, and notify your banks promptly. Claims must be made within 6 months of policy end.
common_questions.section_reference: Contents Cover 24 pages 28-29

common_questions.question: Am I covered if someone is injured at my property?
common_questions.answer: It depends if you own or rent. If you OWN the property, you have Property Owner's Liability cover up to £5,000,000 (Buildings Cover 12). If you RENT/OCCUPY, you have Personal Liability cover up to £5,000,000 (Contents Cover 21). These cover your legal liability for death/injury or property damage to third parties. Not covered: business use, family members, employees (unless domestic staff covered separately), vehicles/craft, transmission of disease, or property in your control.
common_questions.section_reference: Buildings Cover 12 page 33, Contents Cover 21 pages 27-28, Important information under Personal Liability page 27-28

common_questions.question: What if I am underinsured?
common_questions.answer: If your contents sum insured is less than 100% of the full replacement value of all your contents, AXA will only pay a proportionate amount of any claim. For example, if you insured for £50,000 but should have insured for £100,000 (only 50% of correct value), AXA would only pay 50% of any claim. You must notify AXA if the full value exceeds your sum insured.
common_questions.section_reference: General conditions - Maximum limits page 12

common_questions.question: What happens if I need to claim and I'm paying monthly?
common_questions.answer: If you have claimed or are claiming and try to cancel, you won't get a refund. You'll either have to continue monthly instalments until renewal, or AXA may deduct outstanding instalments from your claim payment. If AXA cancels due to fraud, they may not refund any premium and you may have to repay already paid claims.
common_questions.section_reference: General conditions - Cancelling the policy pages 13-14, Claims conditions - Fraud page 18

common_questions.question: Do I need to tell you if my circumstances change?
common_questions.answer: Yes, you must tell AXA as soon as reasonably possible if circumstances change. Examples include: change of address, structural alterations, letting/subletting your home, using home for business, home becoming unoccupied, home no longer occupied solely by you/family, bankruptcy, criminal convictions (except motoring). AXA will tell you if premium or terms change. Failure to notify may result in claims being refused/reduced, policy cancelled/voided, or premium/terms changed.
common_questions.section_reference: General conditions page 12

common_questions.question: Are my belongings covered during a house move?
common_questions.answer: Yes, if using professional removal contractors. Cover includes storage for up to 60 days if part of the move, to any new private residence in UK, Channel Islands or Isle of Man. However, money is excluded, and china/glass/porcelain must be professionally packed. Jewellery and sea transit are also excluded. Mechanical/electrical breakdown not covered during transit.
common_questions.section_reference: Contents Cause 3 - House removal pages 23-24
